meanings.definition: The quality of being reasonable or practical.
meanings.sent1: Her sensibleness in choosing the most cost-effective option saved us a lot of money.
meanings.sent2: His sensibleness in handling the situation prevented any unnecessary conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The sensibleness of bringing an umbrella on a sunny day made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His sensibleness was like a guiding light in the chaos of the project.
meanings.sent5: The sensibleness of wearing a helmet while riding a bike is crucial for safety.

meanings.definition: The ability to make sound judgments or decisions.
meanings.sent1: She showed great sensibleness in choosing the right path for her career.
meanings.sent2: His sensibleness in investing wisely paid off in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The sensibleness of picking ice cream for breakfast seemed odd but delightful.
meanings.sent4: Her sensibleness was a beacon of clarity in the fog of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The sensibleness of studying for the exam early was evident in her high score.

meanings.definition: The state of being aware of and responsive to one's surroundings.
meanings.sent1: His sensibleness in noticing the small details impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The sensibleness of being alert while walking alone at night is important.
meanings.sent3: The sensibleness of talking to plants for good luck made her smile.
meanings.sent4: Her sensibleness was like a radar, always picking up on subtle changes.
meanings.sent5: The sensibleness of looking both ways before crossing the street is a vital habit.
